channel.title: Supporting the FLGS
channel.description:
As a rule i try and support that local game store that runs rpg sessions most weeknights in Nottingham when i do an rpg purchase. That said, i've tried ordering some of the Indy books that are popular on the gauntlet through them and it's been hard going. No matter what they have tried they have not been able to get hold of the games (particularly PBTA games) when i've tried to order them.
Am i right in thinking that most distributors do not carry hard copies of indy games?

item.title: Supporting the FLGS
item.dc:creator: @MorganMontazh
item.description:
@MorganMontazh wrote:

We got our comic store to carry more indie games by asking him to stock them, offering to run showcases of them, and pointing him at IPR (who are very friendly to small retailers with small orders.) Now he carries a decent smattering and Monsterhearts 2 is one of his best sellers.

In the beginning, I’d get him to order 1 or 2 copies of a bunch of games and say, “I can’t afford all of these right now, but if copies are still there in a month or two, I’ll snatch it up.”

item.title: Supporting the FLGS
item.dc:creator: @segedy
item.description:
@segedy wrote:

Asking to special order titles that they don’t have on the shelf, instead of giving up and ordering it yourself on the internet. That way they are encouraged to find the game (creating a channel with the publisher or a distributor who has it), they get the sale, and depending on demand they may start stocking it regularly.

item.title: Supporting the FLGS
item.dc:creator: @segedy
item.description:
@segedy wrote:

As a publisher, I can only reinforce what others here have said. Most indie games don’t sell in numbers significant enough to be carried by the larger distributors (Alliance, ACD, Asmodee, etc) so Indie Press Revolution is the best bet for a game store that wants to carry those titles. It would be great if someone started a similar operation in the UK, but for now Leisure Games and a handful of other game stores are your best bet.

item.title: Supporting the FLGS
item.dc:creator: @jexjthomas
item.description:
@jexjthomas wrote:

My local always has at least a few PBTA games in stock at their locations, and a decent number of other indie games. I haven’t ordered anything through them, but I would imagine they’d be able to get in just about anything–though of course I can’t say for sure! With the caveat that I have no actual insight into how book distribution really works, it seems like it must be something to do with which distributors publishers have deals with, and which ones the stores have deals with. But I’m sure someone hear knows how that works much better than I do!
